alert.note: Alert for Luzerne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:36PM EST until December 20 at 5:40PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Chenango and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Owego affecting Tioga County. Susquehanna River Near Windsor affecting Broome County. Chenango River At Chenango Forks affecting Broome County. Chenango River At Sherburne affecting Chenango County. Chenango River At Greene affecting Chenango County. Tioughnioga River At Cortland affecting Cortland County. Susquehanna River At Towanda affecting Bradford County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. Tunkhannock Creek At Tunkhannock affecting Wyoming County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River near Wilkes-Barre. * WHEN...From late tonight to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Canal Street in Shickshinny and lowlands in Pittston begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 24.2 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM EST.
